name: Hotel La Amistad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told the hotel was recently bought by an American. There is alot of work being done on the inside. It seems when it's finished the place will look pretty nice. The room was nice enough; safe, tv (cable), nice bathroom w/ blow dryer, hot! water, telephone. Staff was great! Internet is available in the rooms and once signed on it was much faster than I expected. Area fine to walk in day, near stores and flea market. Flea market place to buy souveniiers, not not airport or fancy stores.
reviews.title: Under new management

likes.disliked: — work being done on it made dusty

reviews.text: Not a bad place to stay if you're only staying a night or two as we did at the beginning and end of your stay in Costa Rica. Rooms were dated, but spacious and clean (well, the first room we had was anyway! - the second had a really thick layer of dust and lots of cobwebs around the curtain tracks, but I guess it's a little hard to keep on top of things in a dusty city?). Was first a little put off by the iron gate across the doorway, but at night realised this was for our safety which was a good thing. Breakfast was buffet style and filling. Internet access was really slow and the lighting in the internet area at night is terrible - make sure you use during the day! Staff were nice enough.
reviews.title: OK for a bed for a night

reviews.text: We were extremely disappointed in this hotel, which we felt was way overpriced for what it offered. Our simple room was adequate in size, with two good size beds, and had a safe (a real plus) BUT the kitchen (for which we had paid extra) had no pots and pans so was of little use. (There was a microwave but , when we arrived late in the evening, we had no microwavable food with us or appropriate containers.) There was a bathroom with the room but the large cockroach which crawled towards my daughter when she opened the bathroom door was something of a negative. The included breakfast (which was a no frills "dorm-style" buffet) in a pleasant dining area with a nice array of tables was stated to be until 10 a.m. but, when we came down at 9:15 a.m., there were only the last
reviews.title: Disappointing and Overpriced

likes.liked: — There was some one still on duty to register us when we arrived after midnight due to flight delay.
likes.disliked: — I thought it was overpriced, offering very basic accomodation, service and food.

reviews.text: vestiges of some scrambled eggs, rice and fried bananas so we just had cereal, toast and juice. Around 9:35 a.m., some more rice was brought out but no more eggs appeared and no-one came to see how we were doing or to offer us anything.
reviews.title: A place to sleep
Very Nice Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is about 10 minutes walk into town - a pleasant, slightly hilly, walk but not one that we would want to do after dark.

Great value, frriendly staff, Rooms recently remodeled with memory foam matresses. All my requests for service in my room was handeled immediately to my satisfaction. Its a great location in a historic neighborhood in easy walking distance to your favorite sites
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Let me tell you what a beautiful hotel to stay in. The new owner who is Matt is a very good host. Two of my friends and myself decided to stay there by word of mouth and a few other web sights with all saying good to excellent reviews. There is more updating going on in the hotel in the near future by which the owner Matt told us. If you think he is over priced call around and good luck because he is packed almost all the time and his rates are cheap compared to the quality hotel and services you get. You want something name it and they can make it happen for you. Let me tell you what check out his suites and penthouse rooms for the price he gives you you won't believe it. If you have the chance to meet the owner you will know why this hotel is one of the best in San Jose area. It is chica friendly and family friendly. You just have to respect the people around you. Also the rooms are keep neat and tidy. If you want your laundry done a maid the does your room will do it for just ask and its done. The only thing is just take care of the help and watch the hotel come alive. This is truely a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Best hotel in San Jose

likes.liked: — The price per room with services you get

reviews.title: Hotel La Amistad, inexpensive and clean
reviews.text: Hotel La Amistad is located on the main street in La Fortuna. The rooms are set back from the street, so it is quiet. The rooms are simple, clean, and inexpensive, with hot water showers, and some have AC. I noticed a tour group of italian tourists checked in, but most of the guests were ticos. The hotel is family owned, and they are pleasant and helpful. Anything you want is within walking distance.

I have had tremendous success with finding adequate accommodations using the reviews from Tripadvisor . This is why I feel VERY compelled to share my experience when it comes to visiting this hotel. After reading the reviews, I wasn’t expecting luxury, but I was expecting a hotel which had recently renovated its’ rooms. Note: The rooms shown in the “Travelers Photo” section are ABSOLUTELY NOTHING like the rooms I was shown. Hmmm……. (As soon as a return home I will download and post my pictures). The front desk clerk was more than gracious and accommodating, however, this did not compensate (at all) for the “less than comfy” rooms I was offered. I know, expectations are all relative, and yes, the room rate was low; but when I arrived to my first room I was completely “underwhelmed”.
reviews.title: Think Twice Before Reserving A Room

likes.liked: — The service at the front desk was helpful.

reviews.text: The first thought running through my mind was, “This must be a room which has yet to be renovated…..” However, the attendant kindly told me the room, which was no more than a 7x8 ft rhomboid- shaped room, with an adjoining triangular-shaped bathroom with abundant stains on the carpet to match the dusty spider webs.
reviews.title: My home away from home!

likes.disliked: — A little noisy due to remodeling but it is almost over.

reviews.text: As previous reviewers had mentioned, the dining room was nicely appointed and there are 3 computers guests can use on the second floor if you do not have a computer of your own (there’s Wi-Fi available-- or so I thought…..). I ended up having to use the computers in the common area (which by the way, had sticky, dusty keyboards) because the Wi-Fi service was not working (there was no outage at the time). Last, but not least (especially if you’re interested in preserving your lung function and olfactory function) they do not offer non-smoking rooms. I’m sorry; I spoke too soon--- the fact that the only window was (at best) 2x2 ft with bars over them, tucked in the corner of this strangely shaped room was the last straw. So I quickly used the computer to arrange for other accommodations.
reviews.title: The BEST in Costa Rica!

reviews.text: This may seem like a harsh review, and it may sound as if I’m a spoiled traveler, but I promise you I had not set my expectations high, especially given the low price for the room near San Jose Central….. I truly just want to help the person who is traveling to San Jose and looking for the best bargain.
reviews.title: This place is awesome!

likes.disliked: — Does not have lunch or dinner

reviews.text: I stayed in room 312 of La Amistad this past week and loved my stay there! The staff was very friendly and very efficient. My room was quite large and modern. I had a beautiful little patio area that had a nice view of the city. The plumbing in the room was very good (which can be a problem with some hotels in San Jose). The television was a large flat screen that featured over 100 channels. The rates for the room changed after I had booked my room , but the owner of the hotel was very accommodating and only charged me for the rate I was originally quoted.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Staff!

reviews.text: I liked the location of the hotel as it is in a quiet area, yet it is still very close to the downtown action. I will certainly look forward to staying at this fine hotel again in the future.
reviews.title: Super Experience

description: South Beach Miami meets Costa Rican Culture. Located in Barrio Otoya and Amon, upon entering the Hotel you see the beautiful Art Deco Tile and Marble, surrounded by rich, dark native wood beams and floors. 34 rooms include 6 Penthouse Suites with King beds, 24 jet Jacuzzi tubs and personal dry sauna as well as, another 26 Luxury Rooms with either King or Queen size beds. All rooms have 80 channels of Cable TV with HBO and Cinemax, flat screen TVs, hardwire and wireless internet access, refrigerator, digital safe and luxurious mattresses. You will find these quiet Barrio's are away from the noise and traffic of downtown but still only a short 5 minute walk to all of San Jose's main attractions - The National Theatre, Museums, Shops, Restaurants, Casino's, Nightlife and Exotic Parks. As always free wireless, long distance calls to USA and Canada and laundry. Breakfast included in price.
